= Components =

|| *Component Code* || *Component Name* || *Type* || *Function* || *Comments* ||
|| *HCA.FT.PH.PPG* || Posterior Parahippocampal Gyrus || Neocortex BA-36 || Spatial declarative memory || Parahippocampal gyrus ||
|| *HCA.FT.PH.PRR* || Perirhinal Cortex || Neocortex BA-35 || Associate different visual views of objects and their various nonvisual attributes || Parahippocampal gyrus ||
|| *HCA.FT.PH.ET* || Enthorhinal Cortex || Neocortex BA-28,34 || Memory consolidation || 28,34 || Parahippocampal gyrus ||
|| *HCA.FT.HC.CA1* || Ventrolateral Cornu Ammonis || Allocortex || Representing sequences of episodic memory - long-term || Hippocampus ||
|| *HCA.FT.HC.CA2* || Dorsolateral Cornu Ammonis || Allocortex || Gate controlled by the activity of the supramammillary nucleus to control signal propagation between HC lamines || Hippocampus. Receives theta rithm input from Septum Nucleus ||
|| *HCA.FT.HC.CA3* || Dorsomedial Cornu Ammonis || Allocortex || Representing sequences of episodic memory - short-term || Hippocampus ||
|| *HCA.FT.HC.CA4* || Ventromedial Cornu Ammonis || Allocortex || Mediate dynamic regulation of pattern separation in the dentate gyrus || Hippocampus ||
|| *HCA.FT.DG* || Dentate Gyrus || Allocortex || Distinguishing multiple instances of similar events || ||
|| *HCA.FT.PRS* || Presubiculum || Neocortex BA-27 || Path integration, head direction || Major projects to ET, from TH.LD ||
|| *HCA.FT.PAS* || Parasubiculum || Neocortex BA-49 || Spatial navigation and the integration of head-directional information || Major projects to ET, from CA1,AM ||
|| *HCA.FT.PSS* || Postsubiculum || Allocortex || Integrate visual landmarks with internal representations of environments || as measured by hippocampal place cells, fear conditioning ||
|| *HCA.FT.SUB* || Subiculum || Allocortex || Spatial navigation and mnemonic processing || ||
|| *HCA.FD.TH.AN* || Anterior Nucleus of Thalamus || Nucleus || “Extended” hippocampal system || Projects to L4 of presubiculum and receives from postsubiculum, also to CG, RSP; <BR> spatial learning and memory; attentional processes; head direction ||
|| *HCA.FD.TH.LD* || Lateral Dorsal Nucleus of Thalamus || Nucleus || Head direction, spatial learning || From RSP L5,6 BA17,18, RT, LGN ||
|| *HCA.FD.TH.RE* || Reuniens Nucleus of Thalamus || Nucleus || Gate information between OMPFC and HC dependent upon attentive/arousal states || Regulate amount of neural traffic with changes in attentiveness ||
|| *HCA.FD.TH.RH* || Rhomboidal Nucleus of Thalamus || Nucleus || Communication of information across memory delays to guide memory responses || like RE, return projection from PFC to HC, spatial working memory ||
|| *HCA.MM.RP.MRN* || Median Raphe Nucleus || Nucleus || Block or temporarily suspend mnemonic processes in the hippocampus || Directs HC to disregard insignificant events ||

= Connections =

  * HCA.ET (inferior input) – receives inputs from complex multisensory and higher order association areas of cerebral cortex via PCA.PCG
  * fornix (superior input) – receives:
   * ACh fibers from basal forebrain (septal nuclei and basal nucleus of Meynert) - *Novelty*
   * DA fibers from ventral tegmental area of the midbrain - *Reward*
   * 3HT fibers from raphe nuclei (midline pons and midbrain) - *Mood*
   * NE fibers from the locus ceruleus (floor of fourth ventricle) - *Attention*

= Citations =

{{{
- HCA.PH.PR is not important for object perception, but functions only in object memory
- HCA.HC and HCA.SUB are 3-layered cortices with prominent middle pyramidal layer
- HCA.DG is 3-layered cortex with a prominent middle granular layer
- afferent fibers from HCA.FX and HCA.ET terminate on either pyramidal cells of HCA.HC directly or 
  on granule cells of HCA.DG which then project to pyramidal cells of HCA.HC
- HCA.HC.CA1, HCA.HC.CA3 have LTP property, but HCA.HC.CA2 does not
- HCA.HC.CA2 has highly significant difference in membrane potential from CA1, and it is more negative
- HCA.EC (L2) -> (HCA.HC.CA1) -> HCA.HC.CA3
- HCA.EC (L3) -> (HCA.HC.CA2) -> HCA.HC.CA1
}}}
